issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

uBlock Origin v1.49.3b10

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

https://www.vidaextra.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

_No response_

Story panel gets hidden by AdGuard Tracking Protection of all things...

issue.title: [question] dealing with CORS / removing HTML element

labels.name: Question
labels.description: Further information is requested

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [ ] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [ ] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.13 nightly 1 (build 4175, CL 1.11.34)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Slimjet Version 39.0.2.0 (based on Chromium 111.0.5563.41) (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Which device do you use?

Laptop

### Where is the problem encountered?

**CORS Issue**:  https://lvturbo.com/2jshfs7gfdym.html
**HTML Element**: https://www.techpowerup.com/forums/threads/ssd-help-thread.308586/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Disable cache for third-party requests, Block WebRTC, Block Push API, Block Location API, Hide your User-Agent (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Protect from DPI

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> @AdGuardTeam would appreciate some help when dealing with CORS policy as it started happening very often and some websites don't function properly,web players as well. Here is a simple example of the issue(see screenshot). So far what's worked for me was to create those two rules:

   `@@||akamai-video-content.com^$xmlhttprequest`
   `@@||lvturbo.com^$xmlhttprequest`

   but i'm not sure that this is the proper way and i'm worry that my browser is more exposed this way.
   Please advise.
<details><summary>Screenshot ☝️ :</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here --> 
![CORS](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/34774426/21ab6df2-dd38-4183-8b1b-3d4cde7b9b65)

</details> 

2. <comment> Would also need some help properly removing HTML element(see screenshot). Tried many variations and the only rule so far that does the job is:

   `/*manifest*$domain=.......`

<details><summary>Screenshot ☝️ :</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![manifest](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/34774426/5b2d72f8-df51-4d1a-92bb-90a037029a3e)

</details>
Thank you and keep up the awesome work 👍 


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
`$csp` seems to works fine on my end alongside with `$stealth` rule.
Please try to clear website cache or refresh website using <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>F5</kbd>

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardSDNSFilter/blob/master/configuration.json](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2FAdguardTeam%2FAdGuardSDNSFilter%2Fblob%2Fmaster%2Fconfiguration.json) ### Comment > Actually, this is more of a question or request than a report. > > I saw this. > https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardSDNSFilter/blob/master/configuration.json > > I have learned that the components of a DNS filter include the following. > - RussianFilter/sections/adservers_firstparty.txt > - UkrainianFilter/sections/adservers_firstparty.txt > - TurkishFilter/sections/adservers_firstparty.txt > - JapaneseFilter/sections/adservers_firstparty.txt > - DutchFilter/sections/adservers_firstparty.txt > > How about the following then? > - SpanishFilter/sections/adservers_firstparty.txt > - FrenchFilter/sections/adservers_firstparty.txt > - ChineseFilter/sections/adservers_firstparty.txt > > These are not included in the DNS filter components. Why is this? If you forgot to add them, it would be helpful if you could add them to block more ads. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
@mariankubacka 

> Here is the screenshot:

We can't unblock this domain. It is also used for load ads in mobile apps on Android.

But you can unblock it by click in the filtering log, or disable in the `DNS filters editor`.

comment.body:
> а приложение адгард может не дотягивать

Адгард блокирует ровно то, что должен. Ublock из-за `Раскрывать CNAME записи` блокирует то, что не должен. Отключим правило для ублочного фильтра (`https://filters.adtidy.org/extension/ublock/filters/1.txt`).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.49.3b9

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

http://atozmath.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
The regular AdGuard filter list breaks the site by accidentally blocking images and causing a huge gap at the top of the page. It seems to be caused by the filter `*$image,redirect=1x1.gif,domain=atozmath.com`.
By default:
![Screenshot from 2023-05-12 19-19-14](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/89158249/156bf6ca-3928-4890-81cc-b6cb50e162d0)

With an exception filter ($badfilter):
![Screenshot from 2023-05-12 19-22-15](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/89158249/a2b045d5-bfb5-4d3b-bdb1-a7159ef13717)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kantarworldpanel.shoppix&hl=en_GB&gl=US&pli=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fplay.google.com%2Fstore%2Fapps%2Fdetails%3Fid%3Dcom.kantarworldpanel.shoppix%26hl%3Den_GB%26gl%3DUS%26pli%3D1) ### Comment Username: @mattjbr123 > I'm having an issue with the 'Shoppix' app (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kantarworldpanel.shoppix&hl=en_GB&gl=US&pli=1) installed on my Android device (Google Pixel 2XL) when AdGuard is running. > When I try to login I receive an error saying "Connection required. Please try again when you're back online". > I have looked in the filtering log and occasionally see requests being blocked, but not every time I try to log in, only occasionally. I have tried adding exceptions for the requests being blocked, but this doesn't seem to have helped (even after a restart and shoppix-app reinstall). > If I disable 'Route traffic through AdGuard' for this specific app in the AdGuard settings, I am able to login in again. If I then re-enable 'Route traffic through AdGuard' whilst the shoppix app is still running, it acts as if it doesn't have an internet connection, insisting that it is offline. ### Screenshots

issue.title: eksisozluk1923.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://eksisozluk1923.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Feksisozluk1923.com) ### Comment > eksisozluk.com has been blocked by the government multiple times, so the website jumped domains a couple of times. It used eksisozluk2023.com, eksisozluk42.com and now, the latest version is eksisozluk1923.com. So, there are a couple of very annoying ad related issues that Adguard Turkish solves, like if you click a link on the website, it triggers something but since ads are blocked, nothing happens. You need to double click every link. So, if you could move the domain to eksisozluk1923.com or something with a wildcard like eksisozluk*.com, it would really help. Thank you ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.49.3b9

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.express.co.uk/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, EasyList Cookie List

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Cookie warning shows up on the site. Simply hiding it makes the front page's links not work.
The problem seems to be caused by AdGuard's Cookie filter list, and also allows this, which seems like a tracker:
`audit-tcfv2.cmp.quantcast.com/?log=`

2. Screenshots

comment.body: As I recall, `amazon.com#%#//scriptlet("json-prune", "cuepointPlaylist")` , if used alone, had side effect that broke proper time in navigation. Not sure if `amazon.com#%#//scriptlet('xml-prune', 'Period:\has([value="Ad"])', '', '.mpd')` mitigate this, as I can't test now.

`xenforo.info##.vds-cloud`

Куки-уведомление будет убрано.
